documents.document: @gregthobbs @DianeFuller001 So sorry to hear about your sad loss... I agree about bacon (makes Homer Simpson drooling face)... but I agree even more about talking & sharing our problems. Well done for reaching out ðŸ¤— Stay strong, this too shall pass ðŸ’
RT @claremackint0sh: Britain has reached not-even-taking-a-cardigan-just-in-case levels of weather complacency.

RT @mandystevens22: This is what #anxietyfeelslike
âž¡ï¸Normal me going to visit a friend: Picks up car keys or Oyster card & leaves
âž¡ï¸Anxiâ€¦
RT @alicelouisjulie: A wonderful smile from our Chief Nurse. Thank you for popping in to our Nursing Informatics lectures. Surely we are alâ€¦

#anxietyfeelslike
*Spend about an hour writing over-apologetic text message to friend to cancel visit
*feel about a million times worse & spend the whole day crying, wishing I was with my friend
*avoids friend for over a week due to guilt & embarrassment
#welcometomyworld

#anxietyfeelslike
*3-4 hours lying in bed, constant anxious battle in my head
*repeat journey decision cycle at increasingly high speed ðŸ”„ðŸ”„ðŸ”„
*pulse races, starts hyperventilating, feels faint
*starts crying
âš ï¸ F**k it... Iâ€™m not going

#anxietyfeelslike
-Repeats â€œshall I drive or get the train?â€ multiple times
*feels sick, develops headache, starts sweating
*says horrible, unkind & unpleasant things to myself
-Im a failure, Im stupid, Im an idiot <insert lots of awful swear words>
-decide Im a crap friend

#anxietyfeelslike
On the day of the journey:
*wakes at 3am worrying about what time to leave so Iâ€™m not late for a short visit to my friends
-I think Iâ€™ll get the train -no... Iâ€™ll drive
-I said Iâ€™d be there at 11am; itâ€™s a 40 min journey so Iâ€™ll leave at 8am so Iâ€™m not late

#anxietyfeelslike
*opens â€˜notesâ€™ & spends 30 minutes writing a detailed â€˜pros & consâ€™ list for driving or train decision
*studies list, travel apps & screenshots of possible journey/routes/times
*does this at least once an hour for the whole day before the visit

#anxietyfeelslike
-but what if thereâ€™s lots of traffic? -What if I break down? -I wonâ€™t be able to cope
*studies Waze app & Google maps for 25 minutes, scratching head & feeling sick
*Puts down phone for 2 or 3 minutes *picks up phone again & studies all open travel apps

#anxietyfeelslike
-but if I get the train then something might happen & Iâ€™ve got to get a connecting bus too
*studies TfL app for about 20 minutes looking at different routes & times & taking screenshots
-sod that... Iâ€™ll drive. Probably.

This is what #anxietyfeelslike
âž¡ï¸Normal me going to visit a friend: Picks up car keys or Oyster card & leaves
âž¡ï¸Anxious me 24-48 hours before going to visit the same friend: ðŸ¤”Shall I drive or get the train?
-If I drive then what if I feel ill? -ok, Iâ€™ll get the train

RT @honestrecovery: I feel flat and numb and angry. I am impatient. I don't care. I feel like a battery running low.
I was too positive onâ€¦
RT @honestrecovery: Anxiety stopped me doing loads of 'normal' things: get my hair cut, go shopping, go out with friends, go to work, cookâ€¦
@honestrecovery And for the record (a) nothing has been jinxed (b) life isnâ€™t pointless. Keep hope inside you; hope for recovery & hope/knowledge that you will be ðŸ’¯% YOU again soon ðŸ’

@honestrecovery Really helpful, honest post Becky & thanks for sharing. When depression & anxiety work together on us they are a formidable negative force ðŸ‘¹ðŸ‘¹ work hard on self-compassion, reach out to people & do things (even little things) that make you happy. Itâ€™s hard, but worth it ðŸŒšâž¡ï¸ðŸŒ

Thank you all for the love, it means so much
Self esteem drops quickly with #depression; I described myself as a burden last week
Yesterday I felt surrounded by support, encouragement & compassion. Maybe Im not such a burden after all
Normal service will resume shortlyðŸŒšâž¡ï¸ðŸŒ

Just emptied my handbag from yesterdayâ€™s #NHS70 conference #NursingMidwiferyLondon
~4 pens ~a key ring ~bus pass holder ~6 badges ~a triangular highlighter ~a linen bag ~5 lanyards
What, no post-it notes?ðŸ˜³
Once a nurse, always a nurse #oldhabitsdiehard

âœ³ï¸5/5 But the world didnâ€™t stop turning, my tears dried up, my anxiety subsided & I was fine again
Massive thanks to @DannGooding @BrianwDolan @Jonatha85888249 @CAlexanderNHS @ShanleyOliver & others for accepting & supporting me â¤ï¸
& @Liz_ORiordan for ongoing inspirationðŸ’

âœ³ï¸4/5 I held it together nearly all day, then it all became a bit overwhelming at the end
I sat at the front of the huge conference hall with tears rolling down my cheeksðŸ˜¢ anxiety bubbling up inside me, wishing the ground would swallow me up ðŸ˜”ðŸ™ˆ

âœ³ï¸3/5 Although anxious about co-Chairing the #NursingMidwiferyLondon #NHS70 yesterday, the phenomenal outpouring of love & support as well as all the kindness, warmth & hugs I was showered with yesterday shows that it really is ok to be honest about our #mentalhealth

âœ³ï¸2/5 @Liz_ORiordan a breast cancer surgeon & a remarkable woman, has recently spoken openly about recurrence of her breast cancer
So I the spirit of openness I shared yesterday that Iâ€™ve recently relapsed with #depression & #anxiety
It highlights that no one is invincible

âœ³ï¸1/5 I was very moved sharing the stage last year with @Liz_ORiordan discussing
â€œWhen NHS staff become patientsâ€œ @NuffieldTrust
I found Lizâ€™s story so touching; we know our illnesses inside out, we understand the treatment & the prognosis, but we still feel vulnerable & ill https://t.co/Z8kWqfMMpA

You held the audience & spoke well. Your summary & reflection of the day was profound, passionate & professional.
